Reason: The _d configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the size of the hash output generated by the catena function. The size of the hash output affects memory consumption and can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the _d configuration involves performance-related operations within the catena function, such as calculating the tweak value for hashing based on various inputs, which are time-expensive. These operations contribute significantly to the execution time of the function, making the configuration performance-sensitive.
